algorithm_technique: KMP algorithm for prefix matching and string merging
Brute force string merging with prefix overlap check
problem_summary_simple: Find the shortest string containing three given strings as substrings, prioritizing lexicographical order.
problem_summary_technical: Generates all 6 permutations of string merges, using KMP or direct prefix checks to minimize overlap and length.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering all permutations of merging the three strings.
KMP's prefix function is crucial for efficiently finding the maximum overlap between strings.
The lexicographically smallest result is chosen among strings of minimum length.
Brute-force checking all overlaps can be simpler to implement but less efficient.
The core idea is to maximize overlap when concatenating strings.
Iterating through all possible merge orders is necessary to guarantee optimality.
